metadata.Title: CVE-2023-45862 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/usb/storage/ene_ub6250.c for the ENEUB6250 reader driver in the Linux kernel before 6.2.5. An object couldpotentially extend beyond the end of an allocation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-45862` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-220.231~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-220.231~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-220.231~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1163.176~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1126.137~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-220.231~16.04.1').
